Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 195-196. ==Events of the Chōryaku era== * 1037 (Chōryaku 1, 2nd day of the 7th month): The eldest son of Emperor Go-Suzaku (Prince Chikihito, who was would become Emperor Go-Reizei) has his coming of age ceremony.Brown, p. 311. * 1037 (Chōryaku 1, 17th day of the 8th month): Go-Suzaku formally names Chikihito as his heir and Crown Prince. * 1038 (Chōryaku 2, 1st day of the 9th month): Fujiwara no Chikaie was killed by a servant during an attempted robbery; and all the greats of the Fujiwara went into mourning.Monumenta Nipponica, Vol. 59, p. 399. ==Related pages== * Heian period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Keichō 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 1037 1038 1039 1040 Preceded by: Chōgen Era or nengō: Chōryaku Succeeded by: Chōkyū Category:Japanese eras
